inventory.commentary: 18Feb08 Added a sense, modified features, definitions ahouston

sense.name: a formal price offer to buy something
sense.commentary: BID[+event][+speech_act][+offer][+price][+official][+to_buy] Note: implies an intention to pay a price for something, contrast with (Sense 5)
sense.examples: We've put a bid in on that house. Mary has just bid ten thousand for the sapphire earrings. Did you make a bid at the silent auction?

sense.name: an attempt or effort to achieve a goal
sense.commentary: BID[+process][+attempt][+attainment][+of_goal] Note: refers to an ongoing, complex effort to achieve some goal
sense.examples: Will he make a bid for the Presidency in 2008? John is making a bid for Mary's hand in marriage.

sense.name: authoritative command or instruction
sense.commentary: BID[+event][+speech_act][+command][+authoritative] Note: implies the speaker is wielding authority in issuing the command
sense.examples: The courtesans did the Sultan's bid. The children ignored my bid to sit down and be quiet.

sense.name: a declaration of playing a suit in bridge
sense.examples: I didn't pay attention to Mary's bid in the last bridge game. John's bid was eight hearts, wasn't it?

sense.name: an official offer to provide a service or good at a specific cost
sense.commentary: BID[+event][+speech_act][+offer][+price][+official][+to_perform_service] Note: refers to an offer by a provider to complete work at a price. (Contrast this sense with Sense 1)
sense.examples: We thought the bid from the second landscaping firm was too high. The town has received bids from four contractors to build the new library. It was a conflict of interest for his firm to bid on those defense contracts.
